question: This Roman portrait mummy <image 1> from the 1st century AD was discovered in Cairo, Egypt, and now belongs in the collection of Girton College, University of Cambridge. Which well-known fictional character does this woman share her name with?
description: The image depicts an ancient Roman portrait mummy from the 1st century AD. The portrait is painted on a piece of cloth or linen, which has been preserved over time. The face of the woman is visible, showing her features in detail. Below the portrait, there is an inscription written in Greek letters. The text reads "ΣΕΜΙΩΝΗ ΓΡΑΜΜΑΤΙΚΗ," which translates to "Semionē Grammatikē." This indicates the name and possibly the profession of the woman depicted in the portrait. The portrait was discovered in Cairo, Egypt, and is now part of the collection at Girton College, University of Cambridge.
